ThingDef.Name: TreeBase
ThingDef.description: A tree.

ThingDef.label: Grass
ThingDef.description: Wild grass. It grows anywhere that there is a little light and minimally fertile ground.

ThingDef.label: Tall Grass
ThingDef.description: Wild Tall Grass is grass that grew exceedingly high. It significantly slows down anyone moving over it.

ThingDef.label: Haygrass
ThingDef.description: A mixture of nutrient-rich grasses that yield large amounts of Hay. Hay is edible for animals, but not humans.

ThingDef.label: Potato Plant
ThingDef.description: Potato Plants produce nutritious tubers called Potatoes. Potato Plants grow quickly and are a reliable food source crop for basic meals.

ThingDef.label: Corn Plant
ThingDef.description: Corn Plants are large grain plants that produce ears of delicious yellow seeds that are called Corn. Corn Plants grow slowly but yeild lots of food. Corn is useful as a food ingredient or for making Ethanol Fuel.

ThingDef.label: Rice Plant
ThingDef.description: Rice Plants are short grain plants that yields numerous amounts of edible seeds called Rice. Rice is useful as a meal ingredient, can be made into Ethanol Fuel or distilled into Sake.

ThingDef.label: Agave Plant
ThingDef.description: Agave Plants are a wild growing, large-leafed desert plant with edible flowers and stalks that are called Agave Fruits.

ThingDef.label: Strawberry Plant
ThingDef.description: Strawberry Plants produce small, tasty, red fruits called Strawberries. These fruits are delicious even when raw.

ThingDef.label: Cotton Bush
ThingDef.description: Cotton Bushes produce Cotton, a fine plant fiber that can be spun into a textile called Cloth.

ThingDef.label: Devilstrand Mushroom
ThingDef.description: Devilstrand Mushrooms are a slow growing fungi that produce Devilstrand Puffballs. Devilstrand Puffballs can be spun into a textile called Devilstrand Cloth. This fungi was genetically engineered to produce a silk net of the highest grade. It is long rumored to have mystical properties, and it owes its name to the devilish greed that it inspires in people.

ThingDef.label: Xerigium Plant
ThingDef.description: Xerigium Plant is a medical plant that was selectively bred for centuries by settlers, it produces Raw Xerigium. It is sometimes also called the "healer's hand" by tribespeople. The nickname comes from its five major medicinal virtues, and how it was applied by way of a person's hands.

ThingDef.label: Hops Plant
ThingDef.description: A Hops Plant is a flowering plant that yields Hops, an essential ingredient in brewing Beer.

ThingDef.label: Blueberry Bush
ThingDef.description: Blueberry Bushes produce tiny, round, blue colored fruits called Blueberries. Blueberries are tasty when eaten raw.

ThingDef.label: Cloudberry Bush
ThingDef.description: Cloudberry Bushes produce small, amber colored, sweet, raspberry-like fruits called Cloudberries. Cloudberry Bushes are capable of growing well in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: Gooseberry Bush
ThingDef.description: Gooseberry Bush produce small, sweet, somewhat hairy fruits called Gooseberries. Gooseberry Bushes can grow in cold climates.

ThingDef.label: Eggplant Bush
ThingDef.description: Eggplant Bushes produce large, purple, egg-shaped fruits called Eggplant Fruit. Eggplant Bushes grow quickly, as the plant is related to the fast growing Potato Plant.

ThingDef.label: Pumpkin Vine
ThingDef.description: Pumpkin Vines produce large, orange squashes called Pumpkins. The fleshy inside of a Pumpkin is great when baked into a pie.

ThingDef.label: Bean Stalk
ThingDef.description: Bean Stalks produce small, edible seeds that are contained in a soft shell that is called a Bean Pod. Bean Pods can be used as a meal ingredient or can be refined into BioDiesel Fuel.

ThingDef.label: Tomato Vine
ThingDef.description: Tomato Vines produce round, palm sized, red, sharp-tasting fruits called Tomatoes. Tomatoes are related to Potato Plants and grow very quickly.

ThingDef.label: Carrot Plant
ThingDef.description: Carrot Plants produce long, crunchy, orange root vegetables called Carrots. Carrots are refreshing to eat raw and have a long shelf life.

ThingDef.label: Cocoa Tree
ThingDef.description: Cocoa Trees produce seeds in pods that are called Cocoa Beans. Cocoa Beans can be refined into chocolate.

ThingDef.label: Sugarcane Plant
ThingDef.description: Sugarcane Plants produce a type of long grass stalk called Sugarcane. The grass stalks are rich in sucrose, which can be milled to produce Sugar.

ThingDef.label: Aloe Plant
ThingDef.description: Aloe Plants produce Aloe Leaves. Aloe is used as a naturally grown medicine plant, similar to Xerigium.

ThingDef.label: Bamboo Stalks
ThingDef.description: Bamboo Stalks produce Bamboo. Bamboo is a fast growing grass that functions as a wood alternative.

ThingDef.label: Tea Shrub
ThingDef.description: Tea Shrubs produce aromatic Tea Leaves. These leaves make a tasty beverage called Tea when they are brewed with hot water.

ThingDef.label: Apple Tree
ThingDef.description: Apple Trees produce round, palm-sized, red fruits called Apples. The Apple Tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of Apple production.

ThingDef.label: Banana Tree
ThingDef.description: Banana Trees produce long, soft, yellow, sweet fruits called Bananas. The Banana Tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of Banana production.

ThingDef.label: Orange Tree
ThingDef.description: Orange Trees produce sweet, citric fruits called Oranges. The Orange Tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of Orange production.

ThingDef.label: Peach Tree
ThingDef.description: Peach Trees produce soft, fuzzy, sweet fruits called Peaches. The Peach Tree will remain after harvesting and will start another cycle of Peach production.

ThingDef.label: Grape Vine
ThingDef.description: Grape Vines produce small, sweet, berry fruits that grow in clusters. These fruits are called Grapes.

ThingDef.label: Champignon Mushroom
ThingDef.description: Champignon Mushrooms produce white or brown edible caps called Raw Champignon. This robust mushroom has been genetically engineered and is cultivated to produce a filling meat substitute.

ThingDef.label: Oat Grass
ThingDef.description: Oat Grass is a cereal grain that produces Oats. Oats are useful as animal feed or can be cooked into food.

ThingDef.label: Wheat Grass
ThingDef.description: Wheat Grass is a cereal grain that produces Wheat. Wheat can be milled into Flour, which makes bread when baked.

ThingDef.label: Coffee Plant
ThingDef.description: Coffee Plants are green, leafy plants that produce red cherries called Coffee Beans. Coffee Beans are inside of the cherries, and when ground that can be brewed into a tasty beverage called Coffee.

ThingDef.label: Tobacco Plant
ThingDef.description: Tobacco Plants are a green, leafy member of the nightshade family. Unlike other nightshade plants that produce fruits, Tobacco Plants are grown for their Tobacco Leaves. These leaves are rolled and smoked as an addictive drug.

ThingDef.label: Weed Plant
ThingDef.description: Weed Plants produce small, psychoactive buds called Weed. Weed is rolled and smoked as a type of addictive drug. It can also be processed into a textile called Hemp.

ThingDef.label: Lettuce Plant
ThingDef.description: Lettuce Plants produce large, edible leaves called Lettuce. Lettuce is an essential part in many salads.

ThingDef.label: Wild Rose Plant
ThingDef.description: The Wild Rose Plant produces red flowers called Wild Roses. The plant is also known as the Prickly Rose, Bristly Rose and Arctic Rose.

ThingDef.label: Hypericum Plant
ThingDef.description: Hypericum Plant produces a type of medicinal flower called Hypericum. This plant is well-known by its herbal name, the St. John's Wort. Researchers have discovered that Hypericum alters brain chemistry in a way which improves mood.

ThingDef.label: Mint Plant
ThingDef.description: Mint Plants are herbs with aromatic leaves called Mint Leaves.

ThingDef.label: Onion Plant
ThingDef.description: Onions Plants produce vegetable bulbs called Onions. Considered to be a luxury crop, Onions are used in savory food dishes. A pungeant chemcial is released when Onions are chopped that can make you cry!

ThingDef.label: Spectago Flower
ThingDef.description: One of the few known breeds of photochromic flowers, each Rainbow Petal of the Spectago Flower can change color throughout the month depending on how much light they are exposed to. The Rainbow Petals can be used to brew Spectago Tea.

ThingDef.label: Hevea Tree
ThingDef.description: Hevea Trees produce a natural, latex, rubber sap called Caoutchouc. Caoutchouc can be refined through vulcanization to create useful Rubber materials.
